answers.a: Process of forming various metals into special shapes with special equipment & die
answers.b: Process of pulling work piece through conical dies
answers.c: Process to reducing the cross-section work piece

explanations.a: Stretch forming involves stretching and bending sheet metal over a die to create contoured shapes.
explanations.b: This describes a different metal forming process known as drawing.
explanations.c: This is related to processes like rolling or extrusion, not stretch forming.
explanations.d: Incorrect, as only option (a) correctly defines stretch forming.

questions.question: Which material is most commonly used in stretch forming?

explanations.a: Aluminium is the preferred material due to its ductility and lightweight properties.
explanations.b: Brass is less commonly used in stretch forming.
explanations.c: Plastic is not typically stretch formed in the same manner.
explanations.d: Wood is not used in stretch forming processes.

questions.question: Stretch forming is widely used for:

explanations.a: Stretch forming is extensively used in aerospace to shape fuselage panels.
explanations.b: Injection molding is a different manufacturing process.
explanations.c: Casting involves pouring molten metal into molds, not stretching.
explanations.d: Thermoforming is used for plastics, not metal stretch forming.

questions.question: Which of the following metals can be stretch formed?

explanations.a: Aluminium is commonly used due to its excellent formability.
explanations.b: Stainless steel can be stretch formed, though less commonly than aluminium.
explanations.c: Nickel-based steels are less common for stretch forming due to their hardness.
explanations.d: Titanium is also used, especially in aerospace applications.

answers.a: Minimum bend radius is generally 2-3 times greater than other forming methods
answers.b: Minimum bend radius is generally 4-6 times greater than other forming methods
answers.c: Minimum bend radius is generally 1-6 times greater than other forming methods
answers.d: Minimum bend radius is generally 6-8 times greater than other forming methods

explanations.a: In stretch forming, the minimum bend radius is usually 2-3 times the material thickness.
explanations.b: This is not typical for stretch forming.
explanations.c: This range is too broad and not specific to stretch forming.
explanations.d: This range is exaggerated and not accurate for stretch forming.
